Description: Wall sherd (mended from six fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; interior: streaky brown glaze; three friezes of alternating tongues and lotus flowers or buds painted in red and white, separated by red bands lined in white, details incised; exterior, cream slip: three friezes separated by bands with superimposed red bands lined in white; upper frieze has foot of goat to right; middle frieze is of goats to right, heads turned, interrupted by recumbent bird; below, lotus flower and bud chain with red additions. One ancient repair hole with grooving for wire; two modern holes for sampling.
Curator's comments: Attributed to the production centre Teos through NAA (Hans Mommsen, Bonn: sample Nauk 100, NAA group TeosB).
Joins 1888,0601.534.b-d and from same bowl as e-g.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.230)
